name: Accent sweep
description: This algorithm recreates a very specific aspect of the Roland TB-303’s circuitry by generating an AD (attack/decay) envelope which will reach a higher maximum level if repeatedly triggered. The design is based on a detailed technical write-up available at https://www.firstpr.com.au/rwi/dfish/303-unique.html, simulating the internal pulse and resistor-capacitor network that produces the TB-303’s unique accent sweep behavior.
gui_description: The display shows the input (dark) and output (light) signals, visually representing how the AD shaper modifies the incoming signal based on trigger behavior.

parameters.name: Input mode
parameters.description: Sets how the input is treated: 'Direct' feeds the input signal directly into the AD shaper; 'Trigger' uses the input to trigger an internal pulse, which is then fed into the shaper.

input_ports.name: Input
input_ports.description: The bus to use as input for the accent sweep algorithm (1-28).

input_ports.name: Input signal
input_ports.description: Audio/CV input signal fed into the AD shaper, depending on 'Input mode' setting.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: The bus to use as output for the accent sweep algorithm (1-28).

output_ports.name: Output signal
output_ports.description: Processed audio/CV signal shaped by the AD envelope with variable peak.
